intro: Pedicularis annapurnensis, commonly known as the Annapurna lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its striking red and yellow flowers, which bloom in the summer months. It grows in alpine meadows and rocky habitats, often at elevations above 3,000 meters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
